title: Where to Find and Buy Cheap Concert Tickets Online

steps.title: Ticketmaster
steps.content: Ticketmaster While Ticketmaster doesn’t have the best reputation when it comes to purchasing concert tickets (especially for high-demand events), it’s still possible to find cheap tickets on the site or app. Watch for promotions and deals on Ticketmaster’s Deals page . Who knows? You may just find a special offer for one of your favorite bands! Similarly, if you’re a verified Ticketmaster fan and couldn’t snag tickets during a concert’s initial sale, you may be selected for an additional, exclusive sale if more tickets become available. You’ll receive an email if you’ve been selected. Ticketmaster also has an exchange program where fans can resell or trade tickets for specific sporting events at a lower price.

steps.title: VividSeats
steps.content: VividSeats VividSeats is a well-known ticketing selling app and website that allows you to purchase tickets from resellers. You can search and organize concerts by date, price, and location. The app also periodically offers deals and discounts to new users, so it may not hurt to sign up in the days leading up to your favorite artist’s concert.

steps.title: SeatGeek
steps.content: SeatGeek SeatGeek is one of the most established ticket resellers. The app and website break tickets down by price, availability, and best value. Tickets are rated from 1 to 10 to determine how great of a value the ticket is, helping you decide if you’re getting the most bang for your buck. Seat Geek also occasionally offers promotions and deals to its users, so be sure to check your inbox for special offers and discounts.

steps.title: StubHub
steps.content: StubHub StubHub is one of the most popular ticket reselling apps and websites. The company offers resale tickets at a more affordable price. Plus, the company even uses extra measures to protect fans from scammers with their Fan Protect system. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Gametime
steps.content: Gametime Gametime is known for selling last-minute tickets at exceptional prices. If it’s the day of the event, check the Gametime app or website to see if you can snag any discounted seats. Sometimes, the company will even give you a special promo code for signing up, making your ticket that much cheaper.

steps.title: CashorTrade
steps.content: CashorTrade CashorTrade is a lesser-known ticket-purchasing app that allows fans to buy, sell, and trade tickets at face value. Every transaction is insured by the company’s Trader’s Program, so there’s a 100% money back guarantee on all purchases and sales. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Ticketsmarter
steps.content: Ticketsmarter Ticketsmarter isn’t as well-known in the ticket-selling world, but it’s slowly inching up the ranks. This site promises a 100% guarantee when selling tickets and rates prices on a scale of “smartness.” They even offer additional discounts to students, teachers, healthcare workers, veterans, and disabled individuals. For a student discount, upload your information to StudentBeans . For a military discount, disclose your information when creating your Ticketsmarter account.

steps.title: Viagogo
steps.content: Viagogo Viagogo is one of the largest ticket reselling platforms. Fans can purchase resale tickets knowing that Viagogo does detailed security checks on sellers to ensure every ticket and price is for real. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Groupon
steps.content: Groupon While Groupon doesn’t let you buy tickets directly from their site, you may be able to snag a discount or promo code for another ticket reseller. Use the site to search the ticket marketplace you’re using to see if any deals or coupons are available. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Check with the box office on the day of the show.
steps.content: Check with the box office on the day of the show. Believe it or not, some box offices may have cheaper tickets right before a concert or show. These tickets are typically face value, and you won’t be charged extra handling fees that typically come with buying tickets online. Simply go to the venue’s box office the week or day of the event. [5] X Research source Keep in mind that box office tickets are first come, first served, and each box office has its own rules and guidelines on selling tickets.

steps.title: Be on the lookout for contests ahead of the event.
steps.content: Be on the lookout for contests ahead of the event. Radio stations and businesses often run promotions, contests, and giveaways that could give you the chance to win tickets for upcoming concerts. Simply search the concert you want to attend “+ contest” or “+ giveaway” online to find where you can enter. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Buy resale tickets as soon as possible.
steps.content: Buy resale tickets as soon as possible. If the concert sells out almost immediately, try to buy resale tickets right away. Ticket prices tend to spike the longer they’ve been on the market, especially for high-demand events.

steps.title: Avoid buying tickets from strangers.
steps.content: Avoid buying tickets from strangers. While it may be tempting, don’t purchase tickets on social media. Scammers know when a concert is in high demand, and they’ll use your desperation against you. So, protect yourself. Never purchase tickets over social media from someone you don’t know, and never give out payment information. [7] X Research source Remember, if a deal seems too good to be true, it probably is.

steps.title: Plan ahead to ensure you snag the tickets you want.
steps.content: Plan ahead to ensure you snag the tickets you want. If there’s a concert you really want to see, block out the time in your calendar even if you don’t have tickets. This way, if you come across a last minute ticket at an excellent price, you can grab it with no worries. For instance, say you want to see Taylor Swift, and she’s playing 3 shows in your town. Take off work and cancel your plans for those 3 days, just in the event that you do end up scoring tickets the day of or before.

steps.title: What is the cheapest place to buy concert tickets?
steps.content: What is the cheapest place to buy concert tickets? The cheapest place to buy concert tickets is through the concert’s primary sale. There are no scalpers (or people who resell tickets for a profit) during primary sales hiking up the prices—it’s only you and other fans. While it may be possible to get a reasonably priced ticket outside of the general or primary sale, it’s very unlikely that you’ll be able to get it at face value.

steps.title: Do concert tickets get cheaper last minute?
steps.content: Do concert tickets get cheaper last minute? Yes, they do. More often than not, concert tickets get cheaper as the concert approaches, especially on the day of the concert. This is because resellers want to make some money off their tickets, even if that means buckling down. Keep in mind that sometimes ticket prices soar right before a concert’s date. This is because resellers are trying to profit on those making somewhat last-minute plans. The price typically drops within a day (or even hours) before the concert.
